metadata.title: CVE-2014-9721 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
libzmq before 4.0.6 and 4.1.x before 4.1.1 allows remote attackers toconduct downgrade attacks and bypass ZMTP v3 protocol security mechanismsvia a ZMTP v2 or earlier header.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9721` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzmq5 - 4.0.5+dfsg-3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: zeromq3 package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.5+dfsg-3').
